intro: Pentameris colorata, commonly known as the red-flowered pentameris, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, pink to red flowers that bloom in late summer. Its leaves are ovate and have a soft, fuzzy texture. Pentameris colorata is often found in wetlands and along stream banks, where it thrives in moist, sandy soils.
